title: Fragment, "The Lion Strangler", early–mid-12th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metallic thread
Technique: two integrated plain weave structures (lampas)
description: Large tangent roundels with a symmetrical design of a bearded man strangling a lion in each arm. A small animal is under each lion's feet and a pair of small birds between the strangler's feet.  The roundel frame consists of confronted griffons with pearl guard bands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, "The Lion Strangler", early–mid-12th century.
early–mid-12th century. Medium: silk and metallic thread
Technique: two integrated plain weave structures (lampas). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-220.
